00001 /* fetch-DPM.cpp - Detailed Pipeline Model */
00002 /*
00003  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT

00008     return new core_fetch_DPM_t(core);
00009 #else
00010 
00011 class core_fetch_DPM_t:public core_fetch_t
00012 {
00013   enum fetch_stall_t {FSTALL_byteQ_FULL, /* byteQ is full */
00014                       FSTALL_TBR,      /* predicted taken */
00015                       FSTALL_EOL,      /* hit end of cache line */
00016                       FSTALL_SPLIT,    /* instruction split across two lines (special case of EOL) */
00017                       FSTALL_BOGUS,    /* encountered invalid inst on wrong-path */
00018                       FSTALL_SYSCALL,  /* syscall waiting for pipe to clear */
00019                       FSTALL_ZPAGE,    /* fetch request from zeroth page of memory */
00020                       FSTALL_num
00021                      };
00022 
00023   public:
00024 
00025   /* constructor, stats registration */
00026   core_fetch_DPM_t(struct core_t * const core);
00027   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00028   virtual void update_occupancy(void);
00029 
00030   /* simulate one cycle */
00031   virtual void step(void);
00032 
00033   /* decode interface */
00034   virtual bool Mop_available(void);
00035   virtual struct Mop_t * Mop_peek(void);
00036   virtual void Mop_consume(void);
00037 
00038   /* enqueue a jeclear event into the jeclear_pipe */
00039   virtual void jeclear_enqueue(struct Mop_t * const Mop, const md_addr_t New_PC);
00040   /* recover the front-end after the recover request actually
00041      reaches the front end. */
00042   virtual void recover(const md_addr_t new_PC); 
00043 
00044   protected:
00045 
00046   int byteQ_num;
00047   int IQ_num;
00048   int IQ_uop_num;
00049   int IQ_eff_uop_num;
00050 
00051   /* The byteQ contains the raw bytes (well, the addresses thereof).
00052      This is similar to the old IFQ in that the contents of the I$
00053      are delivered here.  Each entry contains raw bytes, and so
00054      this may correspond to many, or even less than one, instruction
00055      per entry. */
00056   struct byteQ_entry_t {
00057     md_addr_t addr;
00058     md_addr_t paddr;
00059     tick_t when_fetch_requested;
00060     tick_t when_fetched;
00061     tick_t when_translation_requested;
00062     tick_t when_translated;
00063     int num_Mop;
00064     int MopQ_first_index;
00065     seq_t action_id;
00066   } * byteQ;
00067   int byteQ_linemask; /* for masking out line offset */
00068   int byteQ_head;
00069   int byteQ_tail;
00070 
00071   /* buffer/queue between predecode and the main decode pipeline */
00072   struct Mop_t ** IQ;
00073   int IQ_head;
00074   int IQ_tail;
00075 
00076   /* predecode pipe: finds instruction boundaries and separates
00077      them out so that each entry corresponds to a single inst. */
00078   struct Mop_t *** pipe;
00079 
00080   /* branch misprediction recovery pipeline (or other pipe flushes)
00081      to model non-zero delays between the back end misprediction
00082      detection and the actual front-end recovery. */
00083   struct jeclear_pipe_t {
00084     md_addr_t New_PC;
00085     struct Mop_t * Mop;
00086     seq_t action_id;
00087   } * jeclear_pipe;
00088 
00089   static const char *fetch_stall_str[FSTALL_num];
00090 
00091   bool predecode_enqueue(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00092   void byteQ_request(const md_addr_t lineaddr, const md_addr_t lineaddr_phys);
00093   bool byteQ_is_full(void);
00094   bool byteQ_already_requested(const md_addr_t addr);
00095 
00096   static void IL1_callback(void * const op);
00097   static void ITLB_callback(void * const op);
00098   static bool translated_callback(void * const op, const seq_t action_id);
00099   static seq_t get_byteQ_action_id(void * const op);
00100 
00101 };
00102 
00103 const char *core_fetch_DPM_t::fetch_stall_str[FSTALL_num] = {
00104   "byteQ full             ",
00105   "taken branch           ",
00106   "end of cache line      ",
00107   "inst split on two lines",
00108   "wrong-path invalid inst",
00109   "trap waiting on drain  ",
00110   "request for page zero  "
00111 };

00114 core_fetch_DPM_t::core_fetch_DPM_t(struct core_t * const arg_core):
00115   byteQ_num(0),
00116   IQ_num(0),
00117   IQ_uop_num(0),
00118   IQ_eff_uop_num(0)
00119 {
00120   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = arg_core->knobs;
00121   core = arg_core;
00122 
00123   /* must come after exec_init()! */
00124   char name[256];
00125   int sets, assoc, linesize, latency, banks, bank_width, MSHR_entries;
00126   char rp;
00127   int i;
00128 
00129   /* bpred */
00130   bpred = new bpred_t(
00131       knobs->fetch.num_bpred_components,
00132       knobs->fetch.bpred_opt_str,
00133       knobs->fetch.fusion_opt_str,
00134       knobs->fetch.dirjmpbtb_opt_str,
00135       knobs->fetch.indirjmpbtb_opt_str,
00136       knobs->fetch.ras_opt_str
00137     );
00138 
00139   if(knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay)
00140   {
00141     jeclear_pipe = (jeclear_pipe_t*) calloc(knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay,sizeof(*jeclear_pipe));
00142     if(!jeclear_pipe)
00143       fatal("couldn't calloc jeclear pipe");
00144   }
00145 
00146   /* IL1 */
00147   if(sscanf(knobs->memory.IL1_opt_str,"%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c:%d",
00148       name,&sets,&assoc,&linesize,&banks,&bank_width,&latency, &rp, &MSHR_entries) != 9)
00149     fatal("invalid IL1 options: <name:sets:assoc:linesize:banks:bank_width:latency:repl-policy:num-MSHR>\n\t(%s)",knobs->memory.IL1_opt_str);
00150 
00151   /* the write-related options don't matter since the IL1 will(should) never see any stores */
00152   if(core->memory.DL2)
00153     core->memory.IL1 = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,linesize,rp,'w','t','n',banks,bank_width,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->memory.DL2,core->memory.DL2_bus);
00154   else
00155     core->memory.IL1 = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,linesize,rp,'w','t','n',banks,bank_width,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->uncore->LLC,core->uncore->LLC_bus);
00156   core->memory.IL1->MSHR_cmd_order = NULL;
00157 
00158   core->memory.IL1->PFF_size = knobs->memory.IL1_PFFsize;
00159   core->memory.IL1->PFF = (cache_t::PFF_t *) calloc(knobs->memory.IL1_PFFsize,sizeof(*core->memory.IL1->PFF));
00160   if(!core->memory.IL1->PFF)
00161     fatal("failed to calloc %s's prefetch FIFO",core->memory.IL1->name);
00162   prefetch_buffer_create(core->memory.IL1,knobs->memory.IL1_PF_buffer_size);
00163   prefetch_filter_create(core->memory.IL1,knobs->memory.IL1_PF_filter_size,knobs->memory.IL1_PF_filter_reset);
00164   core->memory.IL1->prefetch_threshold = knobs->memory.IL1_PFthresh;
00165   core->memory.IL1->prefetch_max = knobs->memory.IL1_PFmax;
00166   core->memory.IL1->PF_low_watermark = knobs->memory.IL1_low_watermark;
00167   core->memory.IL1->PF_high_watermark = knobs->memory.IL1_high_watermark;
00168   core->memory.IL1->PF_sample_interval = knobs->memory.IL1_WMinterval;
00169 
00170   core->memory.IL1->prefetcher = (struct prefetch_t **) calloc(knobs->memory.IL1_num_PF,sizeof(*core->memory.IL1->prefetcher));
00171   core->memory.IL1->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.IL1_num_PF;
00172   if(!core->memory.IL1->prefetcher)
00173     fatal("couldn't calloc %s's prefetcher array",core->memory.IL1->name);
00174   for(i=0;i<knobs->memory.IL1_num_PF;i++)
00175     core->memory.IL1->prefetcher[i] = prefetch_create(knobs->memory.IL1PF_opt_str[i],core->memory.IL1);
00176   if(core->memory.IL1->prefetcher[0] == NULL)
00177     core->memory.IL1->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.IL1_num_PF = 0;
00178   core->memory.IL1->prefetch_on_miss = knobs->memory.IL1_PF_on_miss;
00179 
00180   /* ITLB */
00181   if(sscanf(knobs->memory.ITLB_opt_str,"%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c:%d",
00182       name,&sets,&assoc,&banks,&latency, &rp, &MSHR_entries) != 7)
00183     fatal("invalid ITLB options: <name:sets:assoc:banks:latency:repl-policy:num-MSHR>");
00184 
00185   if(core->memory.DL2)
00186     core->memory.ITLB = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,1,rp,'w','t','n',banks,1,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->memory.DL2,core->memory.DL2_bus);
00187   else
00188     core->memory.ITLB = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,1,rp,'w','t','n',banks,1,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->uncore->LLC,core->uncore->LLC_bus);
00189   core->memory.ITLB->MSHR_cmd_order = NULL;
00190 
00191   byteQ = (byteQ_entry_t*) calloc(knobs->fetch.byteQ_size,sizeof(*byteQ));
00192   byteQ_head = byteQ_tail = 0;
00193   if(!byteQ)
00194     fatal("couldn't calloc byteQ");
00195 
00196   byteQ_linemask = ~(md_addr_t)(knobs->fetch.byteQ_linesize - 1);
00197 
00198   pipe = (struct Mop_t***) calloc(knobs->fetch.depth,sizeof(*pipe));
00199   if(!pipe)
00200     fatal("couldn't calloc predecode pipe");
00201 
00202   for(i=0;i<knobs->fetch.depth;i++)
00203   {
00204     pipe[i] = (struct Mop_t**) calloc(knobs->fetch.width,sizeof(**pipe));
00205     if(!pipe[i])
00206       fatal("couldn't calloc predecode pipe[%d]",i);
00207   }
00208 
00209   IQ = (struct Mop_t**) calloc(knobs->fetch.IQ_size,sizeof(*IQ));
00210   if(!IQ)
00211     fatal("couldn't calloc decode instruction queue");
00212   IQ_head = IQ_tail = 0;
00213 
00214 }

00216 void
00217 core_fetch_DPM_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00218 {
00219   char buf[1024];
00220   char buf2[1024];
00221   struct thread_t * arch = core->current_thread;
00222 
00223   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### BPRED STATS ####");
00224   bpred->reg_stats(sdb,core);
00225 
00226   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### INST CACHE STATS ####");
00227   cache_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.IL1);
00228   cache_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.ITLB);
00229 
00230   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### FETCH STATS ####");
00231   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_bytes",arch->id);
00232   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of bytes fetched", &core->stat.fetch_bytes, core->stat.fetch_bytes, NULL);
00233   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_insn",arch->id);
00234   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of instructions fetched", &core->stat.fetch_insn, core->stat.fetch_insn, NULL);
00235   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_uops",arch->id);
00236   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of uops fetched", &core->stat.fetch_uops, core->stat.fetch_uops, NULL);
00237   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_eff_uops",arch->id);
00238   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of effective uops fetched", &core->stat.fetch_eff_uops, core->stat.fetch_eff_uops, NULL);
00239   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_BPC",arch->id);
00240   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_bytes/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00241   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "BPC (bytes per cycle) at fetch", buf2, NULL);
00242   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_IPC",arch->id);
00243   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_insn/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00244   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "IPC at fetch", buf2, NULL);
00245   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_uPC",arch->id);
00246   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00247   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "uPC at fetch", buf2, NULL);
00248   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_euPC",arch->id);
00249   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_eff_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00250   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "euPC at fetch", buf2, NULL);
00251   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_byte_per_inst",arch->id);
00252   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_bytes/c%d.fetch_insn",arch->id,arch->id);
00253   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average bytes per instruction", buf2, NULL);
00254   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_byte_per_uop",arch->id);
00255   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_bytes/c%d.fetch_uops",arch->id,arch->id);
00256   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average bytes per uop", buf2, NULL);
00257   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_byte_per_eff_uop",arch->id);
00258   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.fetch_bytes/c%d.fetch_eff_uops",arch->id,arch->id);
00259   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average bytes per effective uop", buf2, NULL);
00260 
00261   sprintf(buf,"c%d.fetch_stall",core->current_thread->id);
00262   core->stat.fetch_stall = stat_reg_dist(sdb, buf,
00263                                           "breakdown of stalls in fetch",
00264                                           /* initial value */0,
00265                                           /* array size */FSTALL_num,
00266                                           /* bucket size */1,
00267                                           /* print format */(PF_COUNT|PF_PDF),
00268                                           /* format */NULL,
00269                                           /* index map */fetch_stall_str,
00270                                           /* print fn */NULL);
00271 
00272   sprintf(buf,"c%d.byteQ_occupancy",arch->id);
00273   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total byteQ occupancy (in lines/entries)", &core->stat.byteQ_occupancy, core->stat.byteQ_occupancy, NULL);
00274   sprintf(buf,"c%d.byteQ_avg",arch->id);
00275   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.byteQ_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00276   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average byteQ occupancy (in insts)", buf2, NULL);
00277   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_bytes",arch->id);
00278   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of bytes predecoded", &core->stat.predecode_bytes, core->stat.predecode_bytes, NULL);
00279   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_insn",arch->id);
00280   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of instructions predecoded", &core->stat.predecode_insn, core->stat.predecode_insn, NULL);
00281   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_uops",arch->id);
00282   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of uops predecoded", &core->stat.predecode_uops, core->stat.predecode_uops, NULL);
00283   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_eff_uops",arch->id);
00284   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of effective uops predecoded", &core->stat.predecode_eff_uops, core->stat.predecode_eff_uops, NULL);
00285   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_BPC",arch->id);
00286   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.predecode_bytes/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00287   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "BPC (bytes per cycle) at predecode", buf2, NULL);
00288   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_IPC",arch->id);
00289   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.predecode_insn/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00290   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "IPC at predecode", buf2, NULL);
00291   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_uPC",arch->id);
00292   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.predecode_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00293   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "uPC at predecode", buf2, NULL);
00294   sprintf(buf,"c%d.predecode_euPC",arch->id);
00295   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.predecode_eff_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00296   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "euPC at predecode", buf2, NULL);
00297 
00298   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_occupancy",arch->id);
00299   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total IQ occupancy (in insts)", &core->stat.IQ_occupancy, core->stat.IQ_occupancy, NULL);
00300   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_uop_occupancy",arch->id);

00302   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_eff_uop_occupancy",arch->id);

00304   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_empty",arch->id);
00305   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles IQ was empty", &core->stat.IQ_empty_cycles, core->stat.IQ_empty_cycles, NULL);
00306   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_full",arch->id);
00307   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles IQ was full", &core->stat.IQ_full_cycles, core->stat.IQ_full_cycles, NULL);
00308   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_avg",arch->id);
00309   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.IQ_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00310   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average IQ occupancy (in insts)", buf2, NULL);
00311   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_uop_avg",arch->id);
00312   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.IQ_uop_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00313   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average IQ occupancy (in uops)", buf2, NULL);
00314   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_eff_uop_avg",arch->id);
00315   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.IQ_eff_uop_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);

00317   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_frac_empty",arch->id);
00318   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.IQ_empty/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00319   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles IQ was empty", buf2, NULL);
00320   sprintf(buf,"c%d.IQ_frac_full",arch->id);
00321   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.IQ_full/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00322   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles IQ was full", buf2, NULL);
00323 }
00324 
00325 void core_fetch_DPM_t::update_occupancy(void)
00326 {
00327     /* byteQ */
00328   core->stat.byteQ_occupancy += byteQ_num;
00329 
00330     /* IQ */
00331   core->stat.IQ_occupancy += IQ_num;
00332   core->stat.IQ_uop_occupancy += IQ_uop_num;
00333   core->stat.IQ_eff_uop_occupancy += IQ_eff_uop_num;
00334   if(IQ_num >= core->knobs->fetch.IQ_size)
00335     core->stat.IQ_full_cycles++;
00336   if(IQ_num <= 0)
00337     core->stat.IQ_empty_cycles++;
00338 }
00339 
00340 
00341 /******************************/
00342 /* byteQ/I$ RELATED FUNCTIONS */
00343 /******************************/
00344 
00345 bool core_fetch_DPM_t::byteQ_is_full(void)
00346 {
00347   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00348   return (byteQ_num >= knobs->fetch.byteQ_size);
00349 }
00350 
00351 /* is this line already the most recently requested? */
00352 bool core_fetch_DPM_t::byteQ_already_requested(const md_addr_t addr)
00353 {
00354   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00355   int index = moddec(byteQ_tail,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size); //(byteQ_tail-1+knobs->fetch.byteQ_size) % knobs->fetch.byteQ_size;
00356   if(byteQ_num && (byteQ[index].addr == (addr & byteQ_linemask)))
00357     return true;
00358   else
00359     return false;
00360 }
00361 
00362 /* Initiate a fetch request */
00363 void core_fetch_DPM_t::byteQ_request(const md_addr_t lineaddr,const md_addr_t lineaddr_phys)
00364 {
00365   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00366   /* this function assumes you already called byteQ_already_requested so that
00367      you don't double-request the same line */
00368   byteQ[byteQ_tail].when_fetch_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00369   byteQ[byteQ_tail].when_fetched = TICK_T_MAX;
00370   byteQ[byteQ_tail].when_translation_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00371   byteQ[byteQ_tail].when_translated = TICK_T_MAX;
00372   byteQ[byteQ_tail].addr = lineaddr;
00373   byteQ[byteQ_tail].paddr = lineaddr_phys;
00374   byteQ[byteQ_tail].action_id = core->new_action_id();
00375   byteQ_tail = modinc(byteQ_tail,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size); //(byteQ_tail+1)%knobs->fetch.byteQ_size;
00376   byteQ_num++;
00377 
00378   return;
00379 }
00380 
00381 /* Callback functions used by the cache code to indicate when the IL1/ITLB lookups
00382    have been completed. */
00383 void core_fetch_DPM_t::IL1_callback(void * const op)
00384 {
00385   byteQ_entry_t * byteQ = (byteQ_entry_t*) op;
00386   byteQ->when_fetched = sim_cycle;
00388 }
00389 
00390 void core_fetch_DPM_t::ITLB_callback(void * const op)
00391 {
00392   byteQ_entry_t * byteQ = (byteQ_entry_t*) op;
00393   byteQ->when_translated = sim_cycle;
00395 }
00396 
00397 bool core_fetch_DPM_t::translated_callback(void * const op, const seq_t action_id)
00398 {
00399   byteQ_entry_t * byteQ = (byteQ_entry_t*) op;
00400   if(byteQ->action_id == action_id)
00401     return byteQ->when_translated <= sim_cycle;
00402   else
00403     return true;
00404 }
00405 
00406 seq_t core_fetch_DPM_t::get_byteQ_action_id(void * const op)
00407 {
00408   byteQ_entry_t * byteQ = (byteQ_entry_t*) op;
00409   return byteQ->action_id;
00410 }
00411 
00412 /* returns true if Mop successfully enqueued into predecode pipe */
00413 bool core_fetch_DPM_t::predecode_enqueue(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00414 {
00415   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00416   int i;
00417   int free_index = knobs->fetch.width;
00418 
00419   /* Find the first free entry after the last occupied entry */
00420   for(i=knobs->fetch.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00421   {
00422     if(pipe[0][i])
00423     {
00424       free_index = i + 1;
00425       break;
00426     }
00427   }
00428   if(i<0) /* stage was completely empty */
00429     free_index = 0;
00430 
00431   if(free_index < knobs->fetch.width)
00432   {
00433     pipe[0][free_index] = Mop;
00434 #ifdef ZTRACE
00435     ztrace_print(Mop,"f|PD|predecode pipe enqueue");
00436 #endif
00437     return true;
00438   }
00439   else
00440   {
00442     return false;
00443   }
00444 }
00445 
00446 /************************/
00447 /* MAIN FETCH FUNCTIONS */
00448 /************************/
00449 
00450 void core_fetch_DPM_t::step(void)
00451 {
00452   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00453   md_addr_t current_line = PC & byteQ_linemask;
00454   struct Mop_t * Mop = NULL;
00455   enum fetch_stall_t stall_reason = FSTALL_EOL;
00456   int i;
00457 
00459   /* This gets processed here, so that demand misses from the DL1 get higher
00460      priority for accessing the L2 */
00461   if(core->memory.ITLB->check_for_work) cache_process(core->memory.ITLB);
00462   if(core->memory.IL1->check_for_work) cache_process(core->memory.IL1);
00463 
00464   /* check predecode pipe's last stage for instructions to put into the IQ */
00465   for(i=0;(i<knobs->fetch.width) && (IQ_num < knobs->fetch.IQ_size);i++)
00466   {
00467     if(pipe[knobs->fetch.depth-1][i])
00468     {
00469       Mop = pipe[knobs->fetch.depth-1][i];
00470       if(Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_uop_index].decode.EOM)
00471       {
00472         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.predecode_insn++;)
00473         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.predecode_uops += Mop->stat.num_uops;)
00474         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.predecode_eff_uops += Mop->stat.num_eff_uops;)
00475       }
00476       ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.predecode_bytes += Mop->fetch.inst.len;)
00477 
00478       IQ[IQ_tail] = pipe[knobs->fetch.depth-1][i];
00479       pipe[knobs->fetch.depth-1][i] = NULL;
00480       IQ_tail = modinc(IQ_tail,knobs->fetch.IQ_size); //(IQ_tail + 1) % knobs->fetch.IQ_size;
00481       IQ_num ++;
00482       IQ_uop_num += Mop->stat.num_uops;
00483       IQ_eff_uop_num += Mop->stat.num_eff_uops;
00484 #ifdef ZTRACE
00485     ztrace_print(Mop,"f|IQ|IQ enqueue");
00486 #endif
00487     }
00488   }
00489 
00490   /* shuffle predecode pipe (non-serpentine) */
00491   for(i=knobs->fetch.depth-1;i>0;i--)
00492   {
00493     int j;
00494     int this_stage_free = true;
00495     for(j=0;j<knobs->fetch.width;j++)
00496     {
00497       if(pipe[i][j])
00498       {
00499         this_stage_free = false;
00500         break;
00501       }
00502     }
00503 
00504     if(this_stage_free)
00505     {
00506       for(j=0;j<knobs->fetch.width;j++)
00507       {
00508         pipe[i][j] = pipe[i-1][j];
00509         pipe[i-1][j] = NULL;
00510       }
00511     }
00512   }
00513 
00514   /* check byteQ for fetched/translated instructions and move to predecode pipe */
00515   int byteQ_index = byteQ_head;
00516   while((byteQ_num && byteQ[byteQ_index].when_fetched != TICK_T_MAX) &&
00517         (byteQ_num && byteQ[byteQ_index].when_translated != TICK_T_MAX))
00518   {
00520     if(byteQ[byteQ_index].num_Mop)
00521     {
00522       int MopQ_index = byteQ[byteQ_index].MopQ_first_index;
00523       struct Mop_t * Mop = core->oracle->get_Mop(MopQ_index);
00524 
00525       /* Enqueue Mop into the predecode pipeline */
00526       if(predecode_enqueue(Mop))
00527       {
00528         Mop->timing.when_fetched = sim_cycle;
00529         if(Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_uop_index].decode.EOM)
00530         {
00531           ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.fetch_insn++;)
00532           ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.fetch_bytes += Mop->fetch.inst.len;) /* REP counts as only 1 fetch */
00533         }
00534 
00535         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.fetch_uops += Mop->stat.num_uops;)
00536         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.fetch_eff_uops += Mop->stat.num_eff_uops;)
00537 
00538         byteQ[byteQ_index].num_Mop--;
00539         byteQ[byteQ_index].MopQ_first_index = core->oracle->next_index(MopQ_index);
00540       }
00541       else
00542         break; /* decode pipe is full */
00543     }
00544 
00545     if(byteQ[byteQ_index].num_Mop <= 0)
00546     {
00547       /* consumed all insts from this fetch line */
00548       byteQ[byteQ_index].MopQ_first_index = -1;
00549       byteQ[byteQ_index].when_fetch_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00550       byteQ[byteQ_index].when_fetched = TICK_T_MAX;
00551       byteQ[byteQ_index].when_translation_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00552       byteQ[byteQ_index].when_translated = TICK_T_MAX;
00553       byteQ_num--;
00554       byteQ_head = modinc(byteQ_index,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size); //(byteQ_index+1)%knobs->fetch.byteQ_size;
00555     }
00556   }
00557 
00558 /* still fetching from the same byteQ entry */
00559   while( (PC & byteQ_linemask) == current_line )
00560   {
00561     if(core->oracle->spec_mode) //This can effectively speed up simulation as instructions are requested till a jeclear comes and resets execution
00562         break;   
00563     Mop = core->oracle->exec(PC);
00564     if(Mop && ((PC >> PAGE_SHIFT) == 0))
00565     {
00566       zesto_assert(core->oracle->spec_mode,(void)0);
00567       stall_reason = FSTALL_ZPAGE;
00568       break;
00569     }
00570 
00571     if(!Mop) /* awaiting pipe to clear for system call/trap, or encountered wrong-path bogus inst */
00572     {
00574       if(bogus)
00575         stall_reason = FSTALL_BOGUS;
00576       else
00577         stall_reason = FSTALL_SYSCALL;
00578       break;
00579     }
00580 
00582     md_addr_t start_PC = Mop->fetch.PC;
00583     md_addr_t end_PC = Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len - 1; /* addr of last byte */
00584 
00585     md_addr_t start_PC_phys = Mop->fetch.inst.paddr;
00586     md_addr_t end_PC_phys = Mop->fetch.inst.paddr + Mop->fetch.inst.len - 1; /* addr of last byte */
00587 
00588     /* We explicitly check for both the address of the first byte and the last
00589        byte, since x86 instructions have no alignment restrictions and therefore
00590        may end up getting split across more than one cache line.  If so, this
00591        can generate more than one IL1/ITLB lookup. */
00592     if(byteQ_already_requested(start_PC))
00593     {
00594 #ifdef ZTRACE
00595       if(!Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested)
00596         ztrace_print(Mop,"f|byteQ|first byte requested");
00597 #endif
00598       Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested = true;
00599       if(Mop->timing.when_fetch_started == TICK_T_MAX)
00600         Mop->timing.when_fetch_started = sim_cycle;
00601     }
00602     if(!Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested)
00603     {
00604       if(byteQ_is_full()) /* stall if byteQ is full */
00605       {
00606         stall_reason = FSTALL_byteQ_FULL;
00607         break;
00608       }
00609 
00610       if(Mop->timing.when_fetch_started == TICK_T_MAX)
00611         Mop->timing.when_fetch_started = sim_cycle;
00612 #ifdef ZTRACE
00613       if(!Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested)
00614         ztrace_print(Mop,"f|byteQ|first byte requested");
00615 #endif
00616       Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested = true;
00617       byteQ_request(start_PC & byteQ_linemask, start_PC_phys & byteQ_linemask);
00618     }
00619 
00620     if(byteQ_already_requested(end_PC)) /* this should hit if end_PC is on same cache line as start_PC */
00621     {
00622 #ifdef ZTRACE
00623       if(!Mop->fetch.last_byte_requested)
00624         ztrace_print(Mop,"f|byteQ|last byte requested");
00625 #endif
00626       Mop->fetch.last_byte_requested = true;
00627     }
00628     if(!Mop->fetch.last_byte_requested)
00629     {
00630       /* if we reach here, then this implies that this inst crosses the I$ line boundary */
00631 
00632       if(byteQ_is_full()) /* stall if byteQ is full */
00633       {
00634         stall_reason = FSTALL_byteQ_FULL;
00635         break;
00636       }
00637 
00638       /* this puts the request in right now, but it won't be acted upon until next
00639          cycle since the I$ can only handle one request per cycle and there's a check
00640          below for going off the end of a line that'll terminate the outer while loop. */
00641       Mop->fetch.last_byte_requested = true;
00642 #ifdef ZTRACE
00643       ztrace_print(Mop,"f|byteQ|last byte requested");
00644 #endif
00645       byteQ_request(end_PC & byteQ_linemask, end_PC_phys & byteQ_linemask);
00646     }
00647 
00648     zesto_assert(Mop->fetch.first_byte_requested && Mop->fetch.last_byte_requested,(void)0);
00649 
00650     /* All bytes for this Mop have been requested.  Record it in the byteQ entry
00651        and let the oracle know we're done with it so can proceed to the next
00652        one */
00653 
00654     int byteQ_index = moddec(byteQ_tail,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size); //(byteQ_tail-1+knobs->fetch.byteQ_size)%knobs->fetch.byteQ_size;
00655     if(byteQ[byteQ_index].num_Mop == 0)
00656       byteQ[byteQ_index].MopQ_first_index = core->oracle->get_index(Mop);
00657     byteQ[byteQ_index].num_Mop++;
00658 
00659     core->oracle->consume(Mop);
00660 
00661     /* figure out where to fetch from next */
00662     if(Mop->decode.is_ctrl || Mop->fetch.inst.rep)  /* XXX: illegal use of decode information */
00663     {
00665       Mop->fetch.bpred_update = bpred->get_state_cache();
00666 
00667       Mop->fetch.pred_NPC = bpred->lookup(Mop->fetch.bpred_update,
00668           Mop->decode.opflags, Mop->fetch.PC,Mop->fetch.PC+Mop->fetch.inst.len,Mop->decode.targetPC,
00669           Mop->oracle.NextPC,(Mop->oracle.NextPC != (Mop->fetch.PC+Mop->fetch.inst.len)));
00670 
00671 
00672       bpred->spec_update(Mop->fetch.bpred_update,Mop->decode.opflags,
00673           Mop->fetch.PC,Mop->decode.targetPC,Mop->oracle.NextPC,Mop->fetch.bpred_update->our_pred);
00674 //#ifdef ZTRACE
00675       bool pred_taken = (Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != (Mop->fetch.PC+Mop->fetch.inst.len));
00676       bool taken = (Mop->oracle.NextPC != (Mop->fetch.PC+Mop->fetch.inst.len));
00677       //ztrace_print(Mop,"f|pred_dir= 0x%llx|direction %s",pred_taken,(pred_taken==taken)?"correct":"mispred");
00678       //ztrace_print(Mop,"f|pred_targ= 0x%llx|target %s",Mop->fetch.pred_NPC,(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC==Mop->oracle.NextPC)?"correct":"mispred");
00679 //#endif
00682     }
00683     else
00684         Mop->fetch.pred_NPC=Mop->oracle.NextPC;
00685 //NOTE:pred_NPC is the place where the next PC is fetched from in hardware. In case of non control flow instructions this is calculated as currentPC + length of instructions as the statement below indicates.
00686 //The only exception to this is when hardware interrupts or segmentation faults are seen as implicit jumps in the queue. So intructions which are not control flow ops are succeeded by Inetrrupt routine addresses
00687       //Mop->fetch.pred_NPC = Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len;
00688 
00689     if(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != Mop->oracle.NextPC)
00690     {
00691       Mop->oracle.recover_inst = true;
00692       Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_uop_index].oracle.recover_inst = true;
00693     }
00694 
00695     /* advance the fetch PC to the next instruction */
00697     PC = Mop->fetch.pred_NPC;
00698 
00699     if(Mop->decode.is_trap)     //TRAPS are not control instructions, but there target address is implicitly known by hardware and hence we need to emulate fetching from that position
00700     {
00701         PC = Mop->oracle.NextPC;
00702     }
00703 
00704     if(  (Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != (Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len))
00705       && (Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != Mop->fetch.PC)) /* REPs don't count as taken branches w.r.t. fetching */
00706     {
00707       stall_reason = FSTALL_TBR;
00708       break;
00709     }
00710     else if((end_PC & byteQ_linemask) != current_line)
00711     {
00712       stall_reason = FSTALL_SPLIT;
00713       break;
00714     }
00715     else if((Mop->fetch.PC & byteQ_linemask) != current_line)
00716     {
00717       stall_reason = FSTALL_EOL;
00718       break;
00719     }
00720 
00721   } /* while */
00722 
00723 
00724   ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.fetch_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00725 
00726   /* check byteQ and send requests to I$/ITLB */
00727   int index = byteQ_head;
00728   for(i=0;i<byteQ_num;i++)
00729   {
00730     if(byteQ[index].when_fetch_requested == TICK_T_MAX)
00731     {
00732       if(cache_enqueuable(core->memory.IL1,core->current_thread->id,byteQ[index].paddr))
00733       {
00734         cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.IL1,NULL,CACHE_READ,core->current_thread->id,byteQ[index].paddr,byteQ[index].paddr,byteQ[index].action_id,0,NO_MSHR,&byteQ[index],IL1_callback,NULL,translated_callback,get_byteQ_action_id);
00735         byteQ[index].when_fetch_requested = sim_cycle;
00736         break;
00737       }
00738     }
00739     index = modinc(index,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size);
00740   }
00741 
00742   index = byteQ_head;
00743   for(i=0;i<byteQ_num;i++)
00744   {
00745     if(byteQ[index].when_translation_requested == TICK_T_MAX)
00746     {
00747       if(cache_enqueuable(core->memory.ITLB,core->current_thread->id,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,byteQ[index].addr)))
00748       {
00749         cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.ITLB,NULL,CACHE_READ,0,core->current_thread->id,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,byteQ[index].addr),byteQ[index].action_id,0,NO_MSHR,&byteQ[index],ITLB_callback,NULL,NULL,get_byteQ_action_id);
00750         byteQ[index].when_translation_requested = sim_cycle;
00751         break;
00752       }
00753     }
00754     index = modinc(index,knobs->fetch.byteQ_size);
00755   }
00756 
00757   /* process jeclears */
00758   if(knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay)
00759   {
00760     struct Mop_t * Mop = jeclear_pipe[knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay-1].Mop;
00761     md_addr_t New_PC = jeclear_pipe[knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay-1].New_PC;
00762 
00763     /* there's a jeclear and it's still valid */
00764     if(Mop && (jeclear_pipe[knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay-1].action_id == Mop->fetch.jeclear_action_id))
00765     {
00767 #ifdef ZTRACE
00768       ztrace_print(Mop,"f|jeclear_pipe|jeclear dequeued");
00769 #endif
00770       if(Mop->fetch.bpred_update)
00771         bpred->recover(Mop->fetch.bpred_update,(New_PC != (Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len)));
00772       core->oracle->recover(Mop);
00773       core->commit->recover(Mop);
00774       core->exec->recover(Mop);
00775       core->alloc->recover(Mop);
00776       core->decode->recover(Mop);
00777       //if(Mop->fetch.bpred_update)
00778       if(Mop->fetch.branch_mispred)
00779               /*core->fetch->*/recover(New_PC);
00780       else
00781               /*core->fetch->*/recover(Mop->core->current_thread->regs.regs_NPC);       //In case its a stor mis-ordeing jeclear event we just flush and start from next PC of the thread
00782       Mop->commit.jeclear_in_flight = false;
00783     }
00784 
00785     /* advance jeclear pipe */
00786     for(i=knobs->fetch.jeclear_delay-1;i>0;i--)
00787       jeclear_pipe[i] = jeclear_pipe[i-1];
00788     jeclear_pipe[0].Mop = NULL;
00789   }
00790 }
00791 
00792 bool core_fetch_DPM_t::Mop_available(void)
00793 {
00794   return IQ_num > 0;
00795 }
00796 
00797 struct Mop_t * core_fetch_DPM_t::Mop_peek(void)
00798 {
00799   return IQ[IQ_head];
00800 }
00801 
00802 void core_fetch_DPM_t::Mop_consume(void)
00803 {
00804   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00805   struct Mop_t * Mop = IQ[IQ_head];
00806   IQ[IQ_head] = NULL;
00807   IQ_head = modinc(IQ_head,knobs->fetch.IQ_size); //(IQ_head + 1) % knobs->fetch.IQ_size;
00808   IQ_num --;
00809   IQ_uop_num -= Mop->stat.num_uops;
00810   IQ_eff_uop_num -= Mop->stat.num_eff_uops;
00811   zesto_assert(IQ_num >= 0,(void)0);
00812   zesto_assert(IQ_uop_num >= 0,(void)0);
00813   zesto_assert(IQ_eff_uop_num >= 0,(void)0);
00814 }
00815 
00816 void core_fetch_DPM_t::jeclear_enqueue(struct Mop_t * const Mop, const md_addr_t New_PC)
00817 {
00819   if(jeclear_pipe[0].Mop) /* already a jeclear this cycle */
00820   {
00822     /* keep *older* of the two (don't need to process jeclear
00823        that's in the shadow of an earlier jeclear) */
00824     if(Mop->oracle.seq < jeclear_pipe[0].Mop->oracle.seq)
00825     {
00826       Mop->fetch.jeclear_action_id = core->new_action_id();
00827       Mop->commit.jeclear_in_flight = true;
00828       jeclear_pipe[0].Mop = Mop;
00829       jeclear_pipe[0].New_PC = New_PC;
00830       jeclear_pipe[0].action_id = Mop->fetch.jeclear_action_id;
00831 #ifdef ZTRACE
00832       ztrace_print(Mop,"f|jeclear_pipe|enqueued");
00833 #endif
00834     }
00835   }
00836   else
00837   {
00839     Mop->fetch.jeclear_action_id = core->new_action_id();
00840     Mop->commit.jeclear_in_flight = true;
00841     jeclear_pipe[0].Mop = Mop;
00842     jeclear_pipe[0].New_PC = New_PC;
00843     jeclear_pipe[0].action_id = Mop->fetch.jeclear_action_id;
00844 #ifdef ZTRACE
00845     ztrace_print(Mop,"f|jeclear_pipe|enqueued");
00846 #endif
00847   }
00848 }
00849 
00850 void
00851 core_fetch_DPM_t::recover(const md_addr_t new_PC)
00852 {
00853   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00854   /* XXX: use non-oracle nextPC as there may be multiple re-fetches */
00855   int i;
00856   PC = new_PC;
00857   bogus = false;
00858 
00859   /* clear out the byteQ */
00860   for(i=0;i<knobs->fetch.byteQ_size;i++)
00861   {
00862     byteQ[i].addr = 0;
00863     byteQ[i].when_fetch_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00864     byteQ[i].when_fetched = TICK_T_MAX;
00865     byteQ[i].when_translation_requested = TICK_T_MAX;
00866     byteQ[i].when_translated = TICK_T_MAX;
00867     byteQ[i].num_Mop = 0;
00868     byteQ[i].MopQ_first_index = -1;
00869     byteQ[i].action_id = core->new_action_id();
00870   }
00871   byteQ_num = 0;
00872   byteQ_head = 0;
00873   byteQ_tail = 0;
00874 
00875   memzero(IQ,knobs->fetch.IQ_size*sizeof(*IQ));
00876   IQ_num = 0;
00877   IQ_uop_num = 0;
00878   IQ_eff_uop_num = 0;
00879   IQ_head = 0;
00880   IQ_tail = 0;
00881 
00882   for(i=0;i<knobs->fetch.depth;i++)
00883   {
00884     int j;
00885     for(j=0;j<knobs->fetch.width;j++)
00886       pipe[i][j] = NULL;
00887   }
00888 }
00889 
00890 #endif
Generated on Mon Aug 23 00:20:56 2010 for IRIS by  1.5.8
